div.a: Click Here for Weekly Newsletter of Learning Opportunites and additional resources

h2.div: Follow our Facebook Page: Clearwater R-1 School District for weekly updates on meal delivery during our extended school closure.

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: Who: All children 18 years of age and under.
When: Weekdays beginning Wednesday, March 18, 2020, until school resumes.
Time: 11:00am to 1:00pm
· Drive-thru service at the back of Clearwater Elementary School
· Mill Spring Station
· Patterson Community Center
· Other locations based on need and district survey responses

How: Families may request services via the district survey link on the Clearwater R-1 School District Facebook Page, the district website (www.cwtigers.net), or by calling the administrative office at 223-7426, extension 6.

p.em: Please remember this is new to all of us and the district will do its best to provide for the needs of our families within state and federal guidelines.

h3.div: March 17, 2020 Supplemental Learning Resources for Families

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.a: The President's Coronavirus Guidelines for America

h3.div: March 16, 2020 Black River League Closure Notice

div.p: Dear Black River League Area Parents, Staff and Community:

The unique challenges presented by the COVID-19 pandemic are causing many difficult decisions to be made. Although area counties have no known COVID-19 cases, the League administrators have made the decision, in conjunction with local health authorities, to close our schools in order to safeguard the health and wellness of our students and staff, decrease the burden on the healthcare system, and protect the most vulnerable members of our community.

All Black River League schools will be closed beginning this Wednesday, March 18. Due to extenuating circumstances, Lesterville R-IV will close starting Tuesday, March 17th. This is unchartered territory for all of our districts. It is difficult to predict where we will be a few days, much less two weeks. With that being said, we tentatively plan on welcoming students and staff back on April 6. We appreciate your understanding. As that date approaches, the administration will evaluate the status of the pandemic and will communicate any updates to our families.

The decision of the League administrators was made in conjunction with local officials about the need to practice social distancing, to limit gatherings of large groups in order to decrease the risk to our most vulnerable populations, and to reduce the burden on the healthcare system. Our decision aligns with similar actions being taken to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 by school districts across the region.

Although we know that this will create hardship for many of us, we are now at the point where the closure of our schools is the best decision to help limit the spread of the COVID-19 and to keep our students, families and employees healthy. During the break, we will be performing cleaning and disinfecting above and beyond our established practices at all buildings. We are waiting for guidance from MSHSAA related to athletics and activities. We will share information as it becomes available.
We appreciate your understanding, patience and support in this matter.
Respectfully,
Bunker School District
Centerville School District
Clearwater School District
East Carter School District
Lesterville School District
South Iron School District
Southern Reynolds County School District

div.a: Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education Related Coronavirus (COVID-19) Information

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

h2.div: Every Friday is ORANGE & BLACK DAY! Please wear orange and black on Fridays to show your school spirit!

div.p: Clearwater R-I will provide access to virtual (online) coursework for students. Students and families that are interested in virtual coursework should contact the student's school counselor and inquire about the Missouri Course Access Program (MOCAP). (Policy/Regulation 6190)
